casebody.data:
O'Neal
v.
Inline Fluid Power, Inc. & Automotive Parts Co., Inc., et al. 261PA15-1 Supreme Court of North Carolina. June 22, 2016

Leonard T. Jernigan, Jr., Kristina Brown Thompson, M. Hayes Jernigan, *388Anthony L. Lucas, Attorneys at Law, For O'Neal, Richard.

Viral V. Mehta, Jordan A. Benton, Carl M. Short, III, Attorneys at Law, For Inline Fluid Power, Inc. & Automotive Parts Co., Inc., et al.

M. Duane Jones, Attorney at Law, For N.C. Association of Defense Attorneys.

The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 21st of June 2016 by NC Association of Defense Attorneys for leave to file Amicus Curiae Brief:

"Motion Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 22nd of June 2016."

Unless already submitted, the Amicus Brief shall be submitted to the court within the times allowed and in the manner provided by Appellate Rule 28(i).
